body_html: Also the '&&' at the end of most lines is annoying and confusing. And it probably does not do what you wanted to do. "set -e" at the beginning is a good option if you want a script to fail on first subcommand failure.
body_text: Also the '&&' at the end of most lines is annoying and confusing. And it probably does not do what you wanted to do. "set -e" at the beginning is a good option if you want a script to fail on first subcommand failure.
body: Also the '&&' at the end of most lines is annoying and confusing. And it probably does not do what you wanted to do. "set -e" at the beginning is a good option if you want a script to fail on first subcommand failure.
